clinical_study.brief_title: Hip Replacement in a High Volume Community Hospital: Effect on Length of Stay and Hospital Cost
clinical_study.official_title: Introduction of the Direct Anterior Approach to Hip Replacement Into a High Volume Community Hospital: Effect on Length of Stay and Hospital Cost

lead_sponsor.agency: Anne Arundel Health System Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Anne Arundel Health System Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators propose to evaluate and compare the percentage of patients who are able to be discharged in less than 3 days after undergoing total hip arthroscopy through either a direct anterior or posterior approach, utilizing the identical post operative protocol. The investigators also propose to evaluate the costs associated with the two different approaches to hip replacement in the same group of patients. Post operative resource utilization, discharge disposition, and pain medicine requirement will also be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that a higher proportion of patients treated with the direct anterior approach for hip replacement will be able to leave the hospital in less than 3 days when compared with a less invasive posterior approach. Secondly, decreased length of stay associated with the procedure may reduce hospital costs.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective review of hospital discharge records
primary_outcome.description: The length of stay and proportion of patients who went home in less than 3 days will be determined for each group. To evaluate and compare the percentage of patients who are able to be discharged in less than 3 days after undergoing total hip arthroscopy through either a direct anterior or posterior approach, utilizing the identical post operative protocol.
Hospital cost analysis will be undertaken for each group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After retrospective chart review is complete -- approximately 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of post operative pain medicine requirement will be compared for the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization of inpatient physical therapy resources
secondary_outcome.description: Utilization of inpatient physical therapy resources and post hospital discharge disposition will be compared for the two groups.

arm_group.description: Single surgeon series of 105 consecutive patients who underwent hip replacement via the direct anterior approach on a fracture table
105 consecutive patients previously operated on by a less invasive posterior approach at the same institution. These surgeries occurred prior to March, 2010.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have undergone primary uncemented hip replacement at our institution (Anne Arundel Medical Center) through either a posterior approach or direct anterior approach on a fracture table utilizing the identical post operative protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Consecutive single surgeon series of patients who have undergone primary uncemented hip replacement at our institution through either a posterior approach or direct anterior approach on a fracture table. Posterior approach patient - most recent patient prior to March, 2010, compared with consecutive recent anterior approach patients with minimum of 6 month follow-up.
2. Diagnosis of osteoarthritis, inflammatory arthritis, or avascular necrosis.
3. No previous surgery on affected hip.
4. Age 40-90 at time of surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient not permitted to bear full weight after the procedure, per post operative instructions
2. Hip replacement performed for acute fracture.
3. Previous hip surgery.
